title: Grease spinoff set in Rydell High gets a series order for forthcoming HBO Max streaming service
text:
The 1978 film starring John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John is a bona fide cinema classic.

And the world of Grease is set for a small screen renaissance, with 'spinoff series' Grease: Rydell High ordered to series for forthcoming streaming service HBO Max, according to Variety.

'It’s ‘Grease’ 2.0 but with the same spirit, energy and excitement you immediately think of when you hear any of these iconic songs,' said Sarah Aubrey, head of content at HBO Max at the Mipcom conference in Cannes, according to the trade publication.

The one that I want: Grease 'spinoff series' Grease: Rydell High has been ordered to series for forthcoming streaming service HBO Max, according to Variety

The series will be set in the 1950s, at the school which Danny (Travolta) and Sandy (Newton-John) attended in the original film.

And according to WarnerMedia Entertainment chairman Bob Greenblatt, it will also be a musical.

'We’re going to build out the world of this show which everybody loves, in that musical style, and build basically a High School Musical kind of experience that will be a big fun rock and roll musical,' said the executive.

Summer lovin': 'It’s ‘Grease’ 2.0 but with the same spirit, energy and excitement you immediately think of when you hear any of these iconic songs,' said Sarah Aubrey, head of content at HBO Max at the Mipcom conference in Cannes

The forthcoming series will be produced by Paramount Television, Picturestart and Temple Hill.

HBO Max is expected to launch in April 2020, and has already licensed such high-profile existing content as Friends, The Fresh Prince Of Bel-Air and Pretty Little Liars.

Original content is expected to include new shows from Ellen DeGeneres, an animated series based on the movie Gremlins and the Kaley Cuoco produced thriller series The Flight Attendant.
